Honestly I would be surprised to know that there is someone who does not know about the Counter-Strike in the abolute, and as 90% know that the game is going, it is not necessary to give an extensive analysis that exposes the content of the game. In short, there is not much to say, it is Counter-Strike 1.6 but with graphics from Half-Life 2. If I were to choose between 1.6 and this, although at first I would not know which to choose, in the long run I would keep the Source. Why? Because their graphic and sound aspect are simply unique. CSS does not have great graphics and sound as "advanced" as the one that has Battlefield 3 with the famous setting "War recording" and yes, it is not that their "Kinestetica" is up to date, has its errors and insults during games, but CSS It has a unique aspect, something that is very difficult to explain, but that curiously almost always happened to me with games with a graphics engine Source.

I know CS from the beginnings under beta-times. In the last 10 years, i only played CS:S for fun, to come down, comfy and relaxing. Still on of the best (TOP10) shooters in the world. I think, altough my age, it is time for CS:GO. But i still can't quit completetly with that stuff.

I played with old friends the other week and I truly wish the game community I was a part of still played as much as it should be played. 
I say that not with the *snobby-" This games so much better than CSGO or BF1 or Call of duty" but with the fact and observation that we as a community enjoyed our play time so much more. 

I'm sure I could write more but that is a simple review that covers an important aspect of what made this game awesome. I'm sure CS 1.6 and 1.5 players heck even Quake, feel the same about their games as well.
